baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of showing pictures of black Hurricane Katrina victims (picshowblack) on dictator game giving ($0-$100), for all respondents
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Charitable giving to Katrina victims (dictator game, $0-$100)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Racial priming via pictures showing black victims (picshowblack)
baseline_groups.target_population: US adult internet panel respondents (all races)
baseline_groups.expected_sign: negative (showing black victims reduces giving; paper finds insignificant for full sample)
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline coefficient is -2.30 (SE=3.85, p=0.55, N=1343). Effect is negative but not statistically significant for the full sample. The paper's main contribution is showing that this effect is moderated by racial identification (Table 6), which is outside the core specification search.

global_notes: One baseline group, matching the pre-run surface. No adjustments needed. All 52 specifications preserve the baseline claim object (same outcome concept, treatment concept, estimand, and target population). Functional form variants (log1p, asinh, binary) change the outcome scale but preserve the concept.
